pydent.aqhttp¶

Request class for making raw http requests to Aquarium

This module contains the AqHTTP class, which can make arbitrary post/put/get/etc. requests to Aquarium and returns JSON data.

Generally, Trident users should be unable to make arbitrary requests using this class. Users should only be able to access these methods second-hand through a Session/SessionInterface instances.

Functions

url_build(\*parts) Join parts of a url into a string

Classes

AqHTTP(login, password, aquarium_url) Defines a session/connection to Aquarium.

Exceptions

TridentJSONDataIncomplete(\*args, \*\*kwargs) JSON data contains a null value and may be imcomplete.
TridentLoginError(\*args, \*\*kwargs) Trident is not properly connected to the server.
TridentRequestError(\*args, \*\*kwargs) There was an ambiguous exception that occured handling your request.
TridentTimeoutError(\*args, \*\*kwargs) Trident took too long to respond
class pydent.aqhttp.AqHTTP(login, password, aquarium_url)[source]¶

Bases: object

Defines a session/connection to Aquarium. Makes HTTP requests to Aquarium and returns JSON.

This class should be generally obscured from Trident user so that users cannot make arbitrary requests to an Aquarium server and get sensitive information (e.g. User json that is returned contains api_key, password_digest, etc.) or make damaging posts. Instead, a SessionInterface should be the object that makes these requests.

Initializes an aquarium session with login, password, server combination

Parameters:
  • login (str) – Aquarium login
  • aquarium_url (str) – aquarium url to the server
static _disallow_null_in_json(json_data)[source]¶

Raises :class:pydent.exceptions.TridentJSONDataIncomplete exception if json data being sent contains a null value

_login(login, password)[source]¶

Login to aquarium and saves header as a requests.Session()

static _request_to_json(result)[source]¶

Turns requests.Request instance into a json. Raises custom exception if not.

clear_history()[source]¶

Clears the request history.

static create_session_json(login, password)[source]¶

Formats login information for aquarium

static fix_remember_token(header)[source]¶

Fixes the Aquarium specific remember token

get(path, timeout=None, get_from_history_ok=False, allow_none=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Make a get request to the session

Parameters:
  • path (str) – url
  • timeout (int) – time in seconds to process request before raising exception
  • get_from_history_ok (boolean) – whether its ok to return previously found request from history (default=False)
  • allow_none (boolean) – if False, throw error if json_data contains a null or None value
  • kwargs (dict) – additional arguments to post to request
Returns:

json
Return type:

dict

request(method, path, timeout=None, get_from_history_ok=False, allow_none=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Performs a http request.

Parameters:
  • method (str) – request method (e.g. ‘put’, ‘post’, ‘get’, etc.)
  • path (str) – url to perform the request
  • timeout (int) – time in seconds to process request before raising exception
  • get_from_history_ok (boolean) – whether its ok to return previously found request from history (default=False)
  • allow_none (boolean) – if False (default), will raise error if json_data contains a None or null value
  • kwargs (dict) – additional arguments to post to request
Returns:

json
Return type:

dict

An alias of aquarium_url
